title: Frisians
summary: The Frisians are a Germanic ethnic group indigenous to the coastal regions of the Netherlands and northwestern Germany.[6][7][8][9][10] They inhabit an area known as Frisia and are concentrated in the Dutch provinces of Friesland and Groningen and, in Germany, East Frisia and North Frisia (which was a part of Denmark until 1864).[11] The Frisian languages are spoken by more than 500,000 people; West Frisian is officially recognised in the Netherlands (in Friesland), and North Frisian and Saterland Frisian are recognised as regional languages in Germany.
